availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Mary Cyrene Burch Breckinridge (Lexington, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, resident. Georgetown, Kentucky, native. Married to John Cabell Breckinridge on December 12, 1843. Mother of Joseph Cabell Breckinridge, Clifton Rodes Breckinridge, Frances Breckinridge, John Milton Breckinridge, John Witherspoon Breckinridge, and Mary Desha Breckinridge. Resident of Lexington in 1850 and 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, District No. 1, p. 189B. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, 4th Ward, Lexington, p. 108. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, 2nd Ward, Lexington, p. 105. James C. Klotter, The Breckinridges of Kentucky, 1760-1981 (Lexington: University Press of Kentucky, 1986), 102, 123-124. Find A Grave, "Mary Cyrene Burch Breckinridge (1826-1907)," Memorial #8872592, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/8872592/mary-cyrene-breckinridge (accessed January 17, 2018).
